**In the event City Offices are closed due to inclement weather, completed applications may be submitted electronically via email to evelyn.morse@merkeltx.gov or by mail to 100 Kent, Merkel, Texas 79536. Applications my be submitted in person to the City Secretary’s Office once City offices have reopened.**

**May 2, 2026 City General Election**

**Order of City Election**

**Merkel Sample Ballot**

***Election Day Vote Centers***

[**NOTICE OF VOTING ORDER PRIORITY**](https://merkeltexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/NOTICE-OF-VOTING-ORDER-PRIORITY.pdf)

You can check your voter registration status
[here](https://teamrv-mvp.sos.texas.gov/MVP/mvp.do)
. You need a combination of (1) your Voter ID number or Texas Driver’s License number with date of birth, or (2) your name, county of residence, and date of birth.

You can fill out a registration application
[online](https://www.sos.state.tx.us/elections/voter/reqvr.shtml)
, but an original application with signature must still be mailed to your local county voter registrar.

You can also call the statewide Voter Registration Office at 210-335-VOTE (8683) and request a voter registration application. You may also find voter registration applications at libraries, government offices, high schools, or with volunteer voter registration deputies.

Turn in your application by April 2, 2026. Get an application online
[here](https://www.votetexas.gov/register-to-vote/where-to-get-an-application-2.html)
.

If you moved to a different county, yes. If you moved to a different address within the same county, no, but you should update your address
[online](https://txapps.texas.gov/tolapp/sos/SOSACManager?lang=eng&XXtask=99)
. You can also
[get a new voter registration application](https://www.sos.state.tx.us/elections/voter/reqvr.shtml)
, make note of your new address, and mail it to the Voter Registration Office.

Early voting starts April 20, 2026 and runs through April 28, 2026. Your county’s website will provide exact days and times.

**When is Election Day?**

Election Day is May 2, 2026. Polls will be open 7 a.m. to 7 p.m.

* A copy or original of a government document that shows your name and an address, including your voter registration certificate
* A copy of or original government check

**What about absentee ballots?**

Get an application for ballot by mail
[here](https://www.sos.state.tx.us/elections/voter/reqabbm.shtml)
. You can vote by mail if you are:

* Going to be away from your county on Election Day and during early voting
* 65 years of age or older on Election Day
* Mothers expecting a baby 3 weeks before or after Election Day

Check out
[VoteTexas.gov](https://www.votetexas.gov/)
. Or ask us, and we’ll find an answer for you.
